headline: Factbox: Trump's endorsement power faces test in key elections
author: Reuters
sentences:
* Versus U.S. Representative Jaime Herrera Beutler
* Aug 2 Republican primary for Washington's 3rd congressional district
Former special forces officer Joe Kent has campaigned with far right U.S. representative Matt Gaetz of Florida and told Oregon Public Broadcasting he held a social media strategy call with white nationalist Nicholas Fuentes, though he said he disagreed with Fuentes' "ethno-nationalism."

* Versus U.S. Representative Peter Meijer
* Aug 2 Republican primary for Michigan's 3rd congressional district
Gibbs, a former housing official under Trump, saw his nomination to head the U.S. Office of Personnel Management flounder after lawmakers from both parties questioned his history of inflammatory tweets, including references to baseless conspiracy theories about Democrats and Satanism.

* Versus U.S. Representative Tom Rice
* June 14 Republican primary for South Carolina's 7th congressional district
Trump's pick to unseat incumbent Republican Rice, one of a handful of Republicans who voted to impeach the former leader, is a state representative whose campaign had nearly a half million dollars in the bank on March 31, pointing to a potentially competitive race with Rice.

* Versus Georgia Governor Brian Kemp
* May 24 Republican primary
In 2021, Perdue conceded that he lost his U.S. Senate to Democrat Jon Ossoff, but in March 2022 reversed himself, voicing false claims that the election was stolen, although the evidence of fraud that he cited was part of a case that was ultimately dismissed by a judge.

* Versus U.S. Representative Dan Newhouse
* Aug. 2 Republican primary for Washington's 4th congressional district
Trump's pick to challenge Newhouse is former small-town police chief Loren Culp, who in March called for the execution of a Black man accused of badly injuring a woman by throwing her down the stairs of a train station.

* U.S. Senate seat for North Carolina vacated by retiring Senator Richard Burr
* May 17 Republican nomination contest
Budd, a rank-and-file member of the House of Representatives, had little statewide name recognition before he sought the Republican nomination for what is expected to be a tight race in November.

* U.S. Senate seat for Pennsylvania vacated by retiring Senator Pat Toomey
* May 17 Republican nomination contest
Oz is a celebrity doctor whose public image took a blow in 2014 when he told lawmakers probing bogus diet product ads that some of the products promoted on his show lacked "scientific muster."

* Versus U.S. Representative Nancy Mace
* June 14 Republican primary for South Carolina's 1st congressional district
Trump's backing of Arrington is noteworthy because the South Carolina state representative is challenging a sitting Republican lawmaker who voted against Trump's impeachment.

REUTERS/Erin Siegal McIntyre/File Photo
May 1 (Reuters) - Former U.S. President Donald Trump is trying to demonstrate his power over the Republican Party with more than 150 endorsements of candidates in November's midterm elections that will determine control of Congress for 2023 and 2024.

Senator Lisa Murkowski of Alaska
* August 16 open primary contest
Trump is backing Tshibaka, a former Alaska state administration commissioner, to unseat Murkowski, who was one of just seven Republican senators that voted to convict Trump in 2021 on charges he incited insurrection.

* U.S. Senate seat for Ohio vacated by retiring Senator Rob Portman
* May 3 Republican nomination contest
Trump-backed Vance is best known as the author of best-seller "Hillbilly Elegy" which documented the descent of factory towns in states like Ohio into poverty and drug abuse.

Senator Raphael Warnock of Georgia
* May 24 Republican primary
Walker, a retired football star, is favored to win the Republican nomination contest and public opinion polls already point to a close race in November against Warnock, a Democratic pastor.

Despite Trump's endorsement of Perdue over Kemp, the state's Republican governor who angered Trump by dismissing the former president's false statements about election fraud, Kemp has a double-digit lead over Perdue in public opinion polls.

* Versus U.S. Representative Liz Cheney
* Aug. 16 Wyoming at-large-district Republican primary
Trump threw his backing behind Hageman, a land-use lawyer, in September 2021, looking to punish Cheney, who was stripped of her role as the No.

The Alaska contest has taken on the shade of a proxy war between Trump and Republican Senate leader Mitch McConnell, who vowed to do everything possible to help the campaign of Murkowski, one of the Senate's few moderates.

Trump's decision to endorse Oz has divided Republican Party leaders in Pennsylvania, with a former hedge fund CEO David McCormick and conservative commentator Kathy Barnette also contenders for the Republican nomination.

Mace irked the former president shortly after taking office in January 2021 when she said Congress should consider censuring Trump for his role in his supporters' assault on the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.

He has styled himself as an angry populist in the Trumpian mold but a recent public opinion poll on the Republican nomination contest pointed to a close race with former Ohio state treasurer Josh Mandel.
Even with Trump's endorsement, Budd has trailed former North Carolina Governor Pat McCrory in public opinion polls for much of the race, though in recent polling Budd has taken a modest lead.
Primary elections in the weeks ahead will test Trump's sway with Republican primary voters, though only Nov. 8 will show how many Trump-backed candidates can win office.
Kent's campaign had more than $1 million in the bank on March 31, setting up a strong challenge to incumbent Herrera Beutler, who voted to impeach Trump.
Groups backing Walker's Republican primary opponents are planning ad campaigns that argue Walker can't beat Warnock because of his baggage.
But Trump-endorsed Walker, who has never held elected office, has vulnerabilities including past allegations of domestic abuse.
The winner of the nomination contest will face a Democrat in what is expected to be among the tightest House races in November.
The winner of the primary will face a Democrat in what is expected to be among the tightest races of the November elections.
Tshibaka's campaign had nearly $1 million in the bank on March 31, suggesting she could be a formidable opponent.
Twelve key picks -- including some against incumbent members of his party -- will show Trump's influence.
Former U.S. President Donald Trump speaks during his rally in Selma, North Carolina, U.S., April 9, 2022.
While Newhouse's campaign had nearly $1 million in the bank on March 31, Culp's campaign had $23,543.

His opponent Meijer, who voted to impeach Trump, is far ahead in fundraising.
